text: <@U018X12NRSN> has joined the channel
How do you best make use of the “Exchange Bonus” ?

elements.text: How do you best make use of the “Exchange Bonus” ?

text: Since I am not in the UK I cannot select the 2% commission, and betfair keeps giving me these Exchange Bonus things where you can place a bet (e.g. €50.-) in any market you want and they will pay the first 50.

elements.text: Since I am not in the UK I cannot select the 2% commission, and betfair keeps giving me these Exchange Bonus things where you can place a bet (e.g. €50.-) in any market you want and they will pay the first 50.

text: What is the correct way to value this and how do should I make use of these?

elements.text: What is the correct way to value this and how do should I make use of these?

text: Match bet it and lock in the profit

elements.text: Match bet it and lock in the profit

text: So e.g. I back at odds 2.0 with the 50.- and then I try to lay at the same odds but with stake 25, then any outcome gives 25 profit ?

elements.text: So e.g. I back at odds 2.0 with the 50.- and then I try to lay at the same odds but with stake 25, then any outcome gives 25 profit ?

text: Check the t and c but you may have to lay off elsewhere

text:
*What’s the offer?*

If you place a qualifying bet as set out above, we will match it with a free bet bonus up to the value stated in your message once the qualifying bet is settled.

The free bet bonus will be applied to your account once your qualifying bet has settled and can be used on any Exchange markets.

*When will I receive my free bet and how can I redeem it?*

Your free bet will be applied once your qualifying bet settles you’ll be able to see the details of your free bets in the ‘Free Bets’ section accessed through the header on the main 

Your free bet will expire 6 days after receiving it.  

To use your free bet, add a selection to your betslip that meets the terms and conditions of this offer and ensure the “Use available bonus” slider is activated. If you make more than one selection in your betslip which would comply with the terms of this offer the free bet will be applied to the selection with the longest odds.

*Is there anything else I need to know about my free bet?*

Your free bet can only be used once. 

Stakes are not returned with winnings if your free bet wins. Your winnings will be credited to your main wallet.

elements.text: What’s the offer?

If you place a qualifying bet as set out above, we will match it with a free bet bonus up to the value stated in your message once the qualifying bet is settled.

The free bet bonus will be applied to your account once your qualifying bet has settled and can be used on any Exchange markets.
When will I receive my free bet and how can I redeem it?

Your free bet will be applied once your qualifying bet settles you’ll be able to see the details of your free bets in the ‘Free Bets’ section accessed through the header on the main 

Your free bet will expire 6 days after receiving it.  

To use your free bet, add a selection to your betslip that meets the terms and conditions of this offer and ensure the “Use available bonus” slider is activated. If you make more than one selection in your betslip which would comply with the terms of this offer the free bet will be applied to the selection with the longest odds.
Is there anything else I need to know about my free bet?

Your free bet can only be used once. 

Stakes are not returned with winnings if your free bet wins. Your winnings will be credited to your main wallet.

text: So aside from commission and not necessarily being able to back and lay at the same odds, should you consider the exchange bonus to be worth 50% of the bonus?

text: Because on the other hand, you could back something at fair value with odds 10, then you have a 10% chance of winning 500 so the EV should be 50

text: When you use your bonus bet does it just pay out the profit on the bet or also the stake?

elements.text: When you use your bonus bet does it just pay out the profit on the bet or also the stake?

text: Your understanding of EV is all wrong. Assuming a random bet in an efficient market the EV of your outright bet is 0 regardless of the odds. - edit: as Remi points out below this isn't right in a 'free bet' scenario.

elements.text: Your understanding of EV is all wrong. Assuming a random bet in an efficient market the EV of your outright bet is 0 regardless of the odds. - edit: as Remi points out below this isn't right in a 'free bet' scenario.

text: “Stakes are not returned with winnings if your free bet wins. Your winnings will be credited to your main wallet.”

elements.text: “Stakes are not returned with winnings if your free bet wins. Your winnings will be credited to your main wallet.”

text: You expect a positive return on this bet only because the stake is effectively 0.

elements.text: You expect a positive return on this bet only because the stake is effectively 0.

text: Not sure where my understanding is wrong. You can get a free bet of 50. E.g. you take odds of 10 in an efficient market. If you win (chance of .1) then you make 500. If you lose you gain/lose 0. So EV is 0.1 * 500 = 50

elements.text: Not sure where my understanding is wrong. You can get a free bet of 50. E.g. you take odds of 10 in an efficient market. If you win (chance of .1) then you make 500. If you lose you gain/lose 0. So EV is 0.1 * 500 = 50

text: But if I make the same bet at odds 2.0 and chance 0.5, then I can win 0.5 * 50 = EV 25. Losing this bet doesn’t cost anything.

elements.text: But if I make the same bet at odds 2.0 and chance 0.5, then I can win 0.5 * 50 = EV 25. Losing this bet doesn’t cost anything.

text: I suppose you can look at it that way - although your return at 10 would be 9 X stake.

elements.text: I suppose you can look at it that way - although your return at 10 would be 9 X stake.

text: Yes, so EV goes to 50 as odds go up.

elements.text: Yes, so EV goes to 50 as odds go up.

text: Honestly though - you're over thinking it. Just whack them on anything at 10.

text: E.g. You might be able to find a market where you can back and lay at 50 and 55. You back at 50 (payout is 50*50=2450) then you lay a stake of <http://44.at|44.44 at> odds of 55 (liability is 2400). Outcome is 44.44 profit (98% chance) or 50 profit (2%).

elements.text: E.g. You might be able to find a market where you can back and lay at 50 and 55. You back at 50 (payout is 50*50=2450) then you lay a stake of
odds of 55 (liability is 2400). Outcome is 44.44 profit (98% chance) or 50 profit (2%).

text: Ah, now I get it. For backing: EV = bonus * (odds - 1) / odds | Even if you manage to hedge at the same odds you only reduce the variance but not the EV. So it mostly makes sense to place a lay order at the same odds to hedge.

elements.text: Ah, now I get it. For backing: EV = bonus * (odds - 1) / odds | Even if you manage to hedge at the same odds you only reduce the variance but not the EV. So it mostly makes sense to place a lay order at the same odds to hedge.
